column4: could someone be so kind and point me in the right direction to ask a question about ssh connections?
Generally speaking, if you ssh from A to B and run an X program, the program should show up on A.
would you know how to change that?
It depends on the program -- what are you running?
So, from computer B you're running "ssh -X user@A nautilus", and the nautilus window is showing up on A's screen, not B's?
yea and from a it shows up on a as well
I'm really not sure why that would happen -- it really shouldn't be. :)
My only guess is to investigate the DISPLAY environment variable, which is what X programs use to determine where they should pop up.
that's ok, thank you for trying :)
ok i'll look into it thank you again
would you know how i would execute 'xset dpms force off' for example on the remote machine?
You could try      ssh -X user@host "DISPLAY=:0 xset dpms force off"
that's perfect thank you very much
